TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WakeLockFlags extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumerates values returned by several methods of and taken as a parameter of the , , and members.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.WakeLockFlags AcquireCausesWakeup = int32(268435456)

summary.para: Wake lock flag: Turn the screen on when the wake lock is acquired.

Normally wake locks don't actually wake the device, they just cause the screen to remain on once it's already on. Think of the video player application as the normal behavior. Notifications that pop up and want the device to be on are the exception; use this flag to be like them.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.WakeLockFlags Full = int32(26)

summary.para: Wake lock level: Ensures that the screen and keyboard backlight are on at full brightness.
If the user presses the power button, then the will be implicitly released by the system, causing both the screen and the CPU to be turned off. Contrast with .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.WakeLockFlags OnAfterRelease = int32(536870912)

summary.para: Wake lock flag: When this wake lock is released, poke the user activity timer so the screen stays on for a little longer.
Will not turn the screen on if it is not already on. See if you want that.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.WakeLockFlags Partial = int32(1)

summary.para: Wake lock level: Ensures that the CPU is running; the screen and keyboard backlight will be allowed to go off.
If the user presses the power button, then the screen will be turned off but the CPU will be kept on until all partial wake locks have been released.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.WakeLockFlags ProximityScreenOff = int32(32)
.field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.WakeLockFlags ReleaseFlagWaitForNoProximity = int32(1)
.field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.WakeLockFlags ScreenBright = int32(10)

summary.para: Wake lock level: Ensures that the screen is on at full brightness; the keyboard backlight will be allowed to go off.
If the user presses the power button, then the will be implicitly released by the system, causing both the screen and the CPU to be turned off. Contrast with .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Android.OS.WakeLockFlags ScreenDim = int32(6)

summary.para: Wake lock level: Ensures that the screen is on (but may be dimmed); the keyboard backlight will be allowed to go off.
If the user presses the power button, then the will be implicitly released by the system, causing both the screen and the CPU to be turned off. Contrast with .
